business.headline: IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

entertainment.headline: Jaat box office Day 8: Sunny Deol's 'dhai kilo ka haath' wins audience in 1st weekSunny Deol's 'Jaat' continues to move at a decent pace at the box office even amid a fresh controversy involving Christian community members claiming that a scene in the film hurt their religious sentiments. The film has finished its first week's run.

Case against Sunny Deol and Jaat team for hurting religious sentimentsA man in Jalandhar has filed a case against Sunny Deol, Randeep Hooda and Vineet Kumar Siingh, among others from the 'Jaat' team, for hurting religious sentiments.

Saif Ali Khan on playing diverse roles: Great to have done a Hum Tum, OmkaraActor Saif Ali Khan, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, shared interesting anecdotes about 'Omkara'. He expressed his happiness in getting to play diverse roles throughout his career.

Sonakshi Sinha makes sassy promise to troll predicting divorce with Zaheer IqbalSonakshi Sinha addressed online trolls who commented that her divorce with Zaheer Iqbal is not far. She responded with a witty remark, dismissing the baseless claims.

The Stolen Girl review: A taut, emotionally charged thriller that stirs and surprisesReleased-Wed Apr 16, 2025'The Stolen Girl' is a gripping series that delves into the emotional turmoil of a mother's worst nightmare. With compelling performances and a focus on the complexities of motherhood, this thriller keeps viewers guessing. Read our review.

Anurag Kashyap rejects rumours of quitting films: I'm busier than Shah Rukh KhanFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap shut down rumours of him quitting cinema. In a post on X, he listed his line-up and stated that he's busier than Shah Rukh Khan.

Lorrie Morgan cancels shows to support husband battling mouth cancerLorrie Morgan cancels upcoming performances to care for her husband, Randy White, who is undergoing mouth cancer treatment. Morgan, grateful for support, focuses on family and privacy during this challenging time.

Love Island USA Spinoff: Full cast revealed for 'Beyond the Villa'Peacock's new spinoff Love Island: Beyond the Villa premieres this summer, reuniting fan-favorite Islanders as they navigate fame, relationships, and personal growth outside the villa.

MobLand Episode 4: When and where to stream 'Rat Trap' on Paramount+MobLand Episode 4, "Rat Trap," drops on April 20, 2025. It will stream at midnight PT and 3 a.m. ET. The episode continues the tense crime drama with high-stakes twists.

Dolly Parton to release new memoir 'Star of the Show' this NovemberDolly Parton, 79, announces her new book Star of the Show: My Life on Stage, chronicling her decades-long music career with personal stories, rare photos, and a narrated audiobook.

Meet Shalla-Bal: Julia Garner's Silver Surfer shines in 2025's fantastic fourJulia Garner stars as Shalla-Bal, a female Silver Surfer, in The Fantastic Four: First Steps. The 2025 reboot introduces Marvel's First Family to the MCU, with connections to future Avengers films.

The Marías announce 2025 North American tour, kicking off at CoachellaThe Marías have announced their 2025 Submarine Tour, starting at Coachella. With festival stops, new music, and support from julie and Momma, the tour promises an unforgettable indie-pop experience.

Lily Collins to begin filming Emily in Paris Season 5 in Rome in MayProduction for 'Emily in Paris' Season 5 will kick off in Rome this May, before heading back to Paris. Lily Collins' Emily will explore new romantic dynamics with returning and new cast members.

Thunderbolts IMAX tickets sell out in under an hour across US citiesMarvel fans eagerly snapped up free IMAX tickets for 'Thunderbolts' in under an hour in some major US cities. The film, featuring a team of antiheroes, premieres in India on May 1, 2025.

Gossip Girl star Michelle Trachtenberg's death linked to diabetes complicationsMichelle Trachtenberg, known for her roles in 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' and 'Gossip Girl', has passed away. The NYC medical examiner confirmed the cause as complications from diabetes.

Fantastic Four trailer: Marvel's 1st family sets out to defend Earth from GalactusThe first trailer for 'Fantastic Four: The First Steps' introduces Marvel's First Family with a new twist. The film will arrive in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Tamannaah Bhatia to play Bipasha Basu-like role in No Entry 2: ReportActor Tamannaah Bhatia might have been approached to play one of the leads in Boney Kapoor's 'No Entry 2'. The film already features Varun Dhawan, Arjun Kapoor and Diljit Dosanjh as leads.

Asim Riaz out of Battleground after fight with Abhishek Malhan, Rubina Dilaik?Asim Riaz has reportedly been removed from the reality show Battleground following a heated altercation with co-judges Abhishek Malhan and Rubina Dilaik. The incident escalated after an initial disagreement during the shoot, leading to the cancellation of filming for the day.

L2 Empuraan OTT release: When and where to watch Mohanlal, Prithviraj filmThe highly successful Malayalam film 'L2: Empuraan', directed by Prithviraj Sukumaran and starring Mohanlal, will soon be available for streaming. The film, which faced controversy over its depiction of communal riots, will be on JioHotstar from April 24.

general news.headline: Trump softens stance on EU after Giorgia Meloni meet: Trade deal 100% possibleDonald Trump's bold declaration came amid ongoing tensions over trade tariffs, including a 20 per cent tariff he initially imposed on EU imports and later paused for 90 days.

Gangster behind 14 attacks in Punjab and wanted by NIA arrested in USPassia had claimed responsibility for an attack in which a senior police officer's vehicle exploded near the Gumtala police post in Punjab's Amritsar in January 2025.

Rich Damaad, Poor Damaad: Robert Vadra's art of making millions from scratchRobert Vadra, son-in-law of Sonia Gandhi, capitalised on insider knowledge of solar power projects by purchasing barren land in Bikaner, near grid stations, and sold it for massive profits.

Inside Cambridge's elite brothel scandal that got Indian-origin CEO trappedBehind luxury condos and Harvard's shadow was an elite brothel for the ultrarich, complete with background checks for a USD 600-an-hour 'girlfriend experience'. An Indian-origin CEO is among its long list of patrons that includes doctors, lawyers and entrepreneurs of the Massachusetts-based sex-service network.

Dirty, eating fish: Non-veg row sparks Marathi vs Gujarati clash in MumbaiIn the video that has surfaced from the altercation, an MNS leader is heard saying, 'He thinks Marathis are dirty. That means Maharashtra is also dirty. So, why did he come to a dirty place?'

Pakistan Army chief's Baloch rhetoric echoes Yahya Khan's Bangladesh playbookPakistan Army Chief General Asim Munir's hardline speech invoking the two-nation theory and threatening Baloch insurgents has sparked alarm over the country's return to a rigid, militarised stance eerily reminiscent of the pre-1971 East Pakistan crisis.

US, Ukraine sign memorandum as an initial step towards minerals dealThe US and Ukraine signed a memorandum to initiate a partnership focused on mineral resource development, aiming to attract investments and aid Ukraine's reconstruction.
Instagram launches Blend, a new way of sharing Reels feed with friendsInstagram's Blend is a new feature that lets you share a customised Reel feed with your friends on an invite-only basis.

Trump calls Harvard a 'disgrace' amid backlash over federal funding cutDonald Trump's latest comments come amid nationwide protests sparked by the White House's decision to freeze approximately USD 2.3 billion in federal funding and reports that the Internal Revenue Service is preparing to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status.

JEE Mains Result 2025 Live: JEE Main Session 2 - What's the latest update on results?JEE Mains Result 2025 is expected to be declared soon on the official website, but the exact timing remains uncertain. The NTA has removed the final answer key from the official website without providing any explanation.

Two killed, 6 injured in shooting at Florida State University, campus on lockdownA gunman opened fire near the student union at Florida State University on Thursday, killing two and injuring at least six others, prompting a campus lockdown, chaotic evacuation scenes.

Donald Trump says China reached out on trade talks, TikTok deal on holdPresident Trump said China has initiated contact to resume trade talks following US tariffs. He added the TikTok deal will be delayed until trade issues with China are settled.

Cancerous growth of violence: Governor jabs Mamata Banerjee over Bengal unrestWest Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose blamed Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for the state's political violence and alleged law-and-order failures, while urging collective action against communal unrest.
After sudden baldness, people in this Maharashtra district now seeing nail lossIn Maharashtra's Buldhana, people who had been suffering from hair loss are now reportedly facing nail deformities.

Anurag Kashyap rejects rumours of quitting films: I'm busier than Shah Rukh KhanFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap shut down rumours of him quitting cinema. In a post on X, he listed his line-up and stated that he's busier than Shah Rukh Khan.

Trump optimistic about 'great deal' with China after slapping 245% tariffsDespite sharp exchanges between the US and Chinese leaders recently over the tariff issue, Donald Trump expressed confidence that the two nations would "make a very good deal". He also expressed optimism about trade discussions with the European Union.

Who is Phoenix Ikner? Florida State University gunman, son of a Deputy SheriffTwo people were killed and at least five others have been hospitalised after Ikner opened fire at Florida State University. He has been taken into custody.

IPL 2025, MI vs SRH: All-round Mumbai hammer Hyderabad as Wankhede springs surpriseMumbai Indians (MI) registered their third win of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), beating Sunrisers Hyderabad by four wickets in Match 33 at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Will Jacks emerged as the star for MI with his all-round show.

sports.headline: Varun Chakravarthy reacts to MI vs SRH no-ball controversyVarun Chakravarthy questioned the no-ball rule for wicketkeepers, saying it's unfair to punish bowlers for something they didn't do—sparking fresh debate after the controversial call in the MI vs SRH match.

Brad Haddin says Punjab Kings now believe they can win in any situationPunjab Kings (PBKS) assistant coach Brad Haddin said the players now believe they can win in any situation. "I think it reinsures everything that we're doing; the playing group starts to trust. And wins like that, as you've seen the other night, the way we got ourselves back into the game was special. The players have started to believe that they can win from any situation," Haddin told the reporters ahead of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) clash.

Manchester United in semis after epic comeback vs Lyon, Spurs surviveManchester United and Tottenham Hotspur sealed Europa League semi-final spots in wildly contrasting styles—United through an unforgettable goal-fest against Lyon, and Spurs with a tense, narrow win over a wasteful Eintracht Frankfurt.

How Will Jacks prepared to keep dangerous Travishek quiet? All rounder revealsMumbai Indians all-rounder Will Jacks revealed his plan to keep the dangerous opening pair of Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head quiet against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH). MI clinched a 4-wicket win against SRH to continue their recovery in IPL 2025.

IPL 2025: Rohit Sharma redemption is not far away. Here's whyRohit Sharma showed flashes of his true self during his entertaining knock against SRH on Thursday, April 17. The MI legend may have a big score coming up as soon as the openers seem to have found the right rhythm.

Pat Cummins surprised by tricky Wankhede surface after loss vs Mumbai IndiansSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) captain Pat Cummins revealed that he was left surprised by the tricky surface at the Wankhede Stadium following his team's four-wicket loss against Mumbai Indians (MI).

IPL 2025: Hardik Pandya eager for CSK clash, praises MI bowlers for SRH winHardik Pandya expressed his eagerness to square off against Chennai Super Kings once again for the second El Clasico of the IPL 2025 season. CSK had beaten MI in the previous clash between both teams faced off earlier in the season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
